constituent: bases, rice field, brains, sparkler, soil, dirt, ground
heisigStory: The kanji of this frame refers to the four bases that are placed at the corners of a baseball infield. The elements: field . . . sparkler . . . ground.
koohiiStory1: Playing baseball in a rice field with sparklers stuck into the ground to act as bases.
koohiiStory2: The traditional New Year´s baseball game in Japan is held at midnight in a rice field. They stick sparklers in the ground for the bases so they can be seen, and to be more festive.
